Messages.EmptyActor: It looks like your character doesn't have any content yet. You can change this in the Edit Mode or the Sheet Setup. The buttons to toggle the edit mode or open the setup can be found in the header bar.

ChatCard.MessageNotFound: Message not found - can't update the chosen message.
ChatCard.NoGMConnected: A GM must be connected to the game to update the chosen message.

Stress.Name: Stress track label
Stress.DescriptionHelp: The description will be shown inside the stress track area.

Boxes.Label: Box label style
Boxes.CustomHelp: Enter space-separated list of unicode characters. E.g. "2 4 6 â˜€".

Aspect.DescriptionHelp: Is only displayed when sending to chat
Aspect.Label: Label

Consequence.DescriptionHelp: Is only displayed when sending to chat
Consequence.Label: Label
Consequence.LabelHelp: A label to describe the severity, like "Mild" or "Severe".
Consequence.IconHelp: Normally a number like 2, 4, 6 or 8. Displayed on the left.

Skill.Name: Skill name
Skill.DescriptionHelp: Is only displayed when sending to chat

Options.Headline: Options
Options.IsMagicSkillHelp: If checked, this skills rank will be used to determine the number of magic dice to roll. Hold shift while rolling a skill to activate this feature.

Roll.MultipleMagicSkills: Multiple magic skills found ({skills}). Using the first one to roll.
Roll.NoMagicSkills: No magic skill found. Please add a magic skill to your character sheet and roll again.
Roll.MagicSkillTooLow: The magic skill rank is zero or less. Please increase the rank to roll magic dice.

Automation.Headline: Automation
Automation.Description: There are no skill conditions set yet. Please add one or more skill conditions to enable automation features.

Dialog.ReferenceRemoveText: Do you really want to permanently remove this reference?
Dialog.DocumentDeleteText: Do you really want to permanently delete this entity?
Dialog.ActorClearText: Do you really want to permanently delete all this actors components and their content of the chosen type?

Templates.Title: Character sheet templates
Templates.Hint: Allows you to choose how character sheets will look like for new characters.

App.Title: Configure Templates
App.Label: Settings
App.Help:
There are no configured templates yet.
To add a new template, click on the Create new template button (also available in the header bar).

Alpha.Name: Enable alpha features
Alpha.Hint: This setting enables experimental FateX alpha features. Alpha features are subject to change.

autoUpdateTokenName.Name: Automatically update prototype token name
autoUpdateTokenName.Hint: Automatically updates the prototype token name when an actors name is changed (if both were identical).

magicSystemEnabled.Name: Enable the magic system from GuildCodex
magicSystemEnabled.Hint: This will add a magic skill to the character sheet and allow you to use magic dice.

Picker.Title: Choose Template
Picker.Label: Templates
Picker.Help: To add new templates, click on the Configuration button below (also available in the header bar).
Picker.Explain: Templates are a great way to have different sheets for different kinds of actors. We suggest using different templates for PCs, NPCs, and Mooks, as all of them have different sheet requirements.

Notifications.ManualOnly: This groups actors are managed automatically. If you want to manually add actors, change the groups type to "manual".
